com.jokes.classifier.common

Class BaesyanUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jokes.classifier.common.BaesyanUtil

  • public class BaesyanUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements all the calculations for the naive Bayes classifier.
    Author:
    Milica Borisova, Yasen Trifonov

      • processWordProbabilities

        private void processWordProbabilities(java.util.List<ClassifiedJoke> jokes)
        Calculates the positive/negative probabilities for every word in the training set.
        Parameters:
        jokes - The training set of jokes.

      • countPositiveAndNegativeWords

        private void countPositiveAndNegativeWords(java.util.List<ClassifiedJoke> jokes)
        Finds how many times a given word has been used in a positive/negative joke. TODO(yasen) maybe separate in two - countPositive and countNegative.
        Parameters:
        jokes - List of jokes. Also calculates: 1) positiveWordsCount -- Total amount of words found in positive jokes. 2) negativeWordsCount -- Total amount of words found in negative jokes.

      • calculateWordProbabilities

        private void calculateWordProbabilities()
        Calculates the positive and negative probabilities for all words in the vocabulary. More formally: P(word | +) and P(word | -). The positive probabilities are set in wordsProbabilityPos, while the negative ones in wordsProbabilityNeg.

      • getProbabilities

        private void getProbabilities(java.util.List<ClassifiedJoke> jokes)
        Calculates the probabilities P(joke is good) and P(joke is bad).
        Parameters:
        jokes - The training set of jokes.

      • isTheJokeGood

        public boolean isTheJokeGood(java.lang.String jokeText)
        Simple helper that checks if a joke is good.
        Parameters:
        jokeText - The text of the current (unclassified) joke.
        Returns:
        isGoodJoke Whether the joke is good.

      • predictJokeRating

        public double predictJokeRating(java.lang.String jokeText)
        Predicts a joke rating with a naive Bayes classification. The calculation of the positive/negative rating uses is done with summation of logarithms instead of product of small numbers in order to increase precision.
        Parameters:
        jokeText - The text of the joke we want to classify.
        Returns:
        negative if the joke is classified as bad, non-negative otherwise.
